snippet: At a time of austerity and fallout from the phone hacking scandal, Britons were expected on Thursday to use mayoral and local council elections as a rebuke of their country’ s coalition government.
lead_paragraph: At a time of deepening austerity, social cutbacks and political fallout from the long-running phone hacking scandal, Britons went to the polls on Thursday in bellwether mayoral and local council votes seen as likely to offer a midterm judgment -- and most likely a rebuke -- to the country's first coalition government since World War II. Just two years after the national vote that brought Prime Minister David Cameron to power in an awkward alliance with the Liberal Democrats, voters were choosing mayors in London in the south and, in the northwest, Liverpool and Salford, along with 181 councils across mainland Britain.

headline.main: Britons Vote in Bellwether Midterm Ballot
